lock."}},"FundsReleased(address,address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of funds that were locked.","currency":"The address of the currency in which the funds were Use `address(0)` for native tokens.","from":"The address of the account that granted the approval.","to":"The address of the recipient for whom the approval was made."},"returns":{"_0":"The amount of funds approved by `from` for `to` in the specified `currency`."}},"getBalance(address)":{"details":"The function checks the balance for both native and ERC-20 tokens.","params":{"currency":"The address of the currency to check the balance of."}},"getLedgerBalance(address,address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account whose balance is being queried.","currency":"The address of the currency to retrieve the balance for."}},"isConsumingScheduledOp()":{"details":"Returns true only in the context of a delayed restricted call, at the moment that the scheduled operation is being consumed. Prevents denial of service for delayed restricted calls in the case that the contract performs attacker controlled calls."},"lock(address,uint256,address)":{"details":"The funds are immobilized and cannot be withdrawn or transferred until released.      Only operator role can handle this methods.      A reserve is not needed, the protocol operate directly on the user funds to simplify operations.","params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the funds will be locked.","amount":"The amount of funds to lock.","currency":"The currency to associate lock with. Use address(0) for the native coin."}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"release(address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the funds will be released.","amount":"The amount of funds to release.","currency":"The currency to associate release with. Use address(0) for the native coin."}},"revoke(address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"currency":"The address of the ERC20 token associated with the approval. The caller must be the current authority."},"transfer(address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens to transfer.","currency":"The address of the currency to transfer. Use `address(0)` for the native coin.","recipient":"The address of the account to credit with the transfer."}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. recipient."},"getApprovedAmount(address,address,address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the approved balance for a specific relationship and currency."},"getBalance(address)":{"notice":"Returns the general's balance for the specified currency."},"getLedgerBalance(address,address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the ledger balance of an account for a specific currency."},"lock(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Locks a specific amount of funds for a given account."},"release(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Release a specific amount of funds from locked pool."},"revoke(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Revokes the approved funds from the caller's balance for a specific recipient."},"transfer(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Transfers tokens internally within the ledger from the caller to a specified recipient."},"withdraw(address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Withdraws tokens from the contract to a specified recipient's params.amount: The amount of funds to approve.
params.currency: The address of the ERC20 token to approve. Use `address(0)` for native tokens.
params.to: The address of the recipient for whom the funds are being approved.

claim(address,uint256,address).details: The claimer is authorized to process the funds from the account.      Only operator role can handle this methods.

params.account: The address of the account whose funds are being claimed.
params.amount: The amount of funds to claim.
params.currency: The currency to associate claim with. Use address(0) for the native coin.

params.amount: The amount of funds to collect.
params.currency: The address of the ERC20 token to collect. Use `address(0)` for native tokens.
params.from: The address of the account from which the reserved funds are being collected.

params.amount: The amount of currency to deposit.
params.currency: The address of the ERC20 token to deposit.
params.recipient: The address of the account to credit with the deposit.

params.currency: The address of the currency approved. Use `address(0)` for native tokens.
params.from: The address of the account that granted the approval.
params.to: The address of the recipient for whom the approval was made.

returns._0: The amount of funds approved by `from` for `to` in the specified `currency`.

getBalance(address).details: The function checks the balance for both native and ERC-20 tokens.

params.currency: The address of the currency to check the balance of.

params.account: The address of the account whose balance is being queried.
params.currency: The address of the currency to retrieve the balance for.

isConsumingScheduledOp().details: Returns true only in the context of a delayed restricted call, at the moment that the scheduled operation is being consumed. Prevents denial of service for delayed restricted calls in the case that the contract performs attacker controlled calls.

lock(address,uint256,address).details: The funds are immobilized and cannot be withdrawn or transferred until released.      Only operator role can handle this methods.      A reserve is not needed, the protocol operate directly on the user funds to simplify operations.

params.account: The address of the account for which the funds will be locked.
params.amount: The amount of funds to lock.
params.currency: The currency to associate lock with. Use address(0) for the native coin.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.account: The address of the account for which the funds will be released.
params.amount: The amount of funds to release.
params.currency: The currency to associate release with. Use address(0) for the native coin.
The address of the ERC20 token associated with the approval. Use `address(0)` for native tokens.
params.to: The address of the recipient whose approval is being revoked.

returns._0: The amount of funds that were revoked from the approval.

setAuthority(address).details: Transfers control to a new authority. The caller must be the current authority.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to transfer.
params.currency: The address of the currency to transfer. Use `address(0)` for the native coin.
params.recipient: The address of the account to credit with the transfer.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw.
params.currency: The currency to associate fees with. Use address(0) for the native coin.
params.recipient: The address that will receive the withdrawn tokens.

approve(address,uint256,address).notice: Approves a specific amount of funds from the caller's balance for a recipient.

claim(address,uint256,address).notice: Claims a specific amount of locked funds on behalf of a claimer.

collect(address,uint256,address).notice: Collects a specific amount of previously reserved funds.

deposit(address,uint256,address).notice: Deposits a specified amount of currency into the treasury for a given recipient.

getApprovedAmount(address,address,addres.notice: Retrieves the approved balance for a specific relationship and currency.

getBalance(address).notice: Returns the general's balance for the specified currency.

getLedgerBalance(address,address).notice: Retrieves the ledger balance of an account for a specific currency.

lock(address,uint256,address).notice: Locks a specific amount of funds for a given account.

release(address,uint256,address).notice: Release a specific amount of funds from locked pool.

revoke(address,uint256,address).notice: Revokes the approved funds from the caller's balance for a specific recipient.

transfer(address,uint256,address).notice: Transfers tokens internally within the ledger from the caller to a specified recipient.

withdraw(address,uint256,address).notice: Withdraws tokens from the contract to a specified recipient's address.

documentation.text: @dev Holds the registry of locked funds for accounts.

@notice Thrown when there are no available funds to lock.
 @dev This error occurs if an account attempts to lock more funds than available.

@notice Thrown when there are no locked funds available to claim.
 @dev This error occurs if an account or claimer tries to claim funds that are not locked or insufficient.

@notice Thrown when there are no locked funds available to release.
 @dev This error occurs if an operator tries to releases funds that are not locked or insufficient.
